comment: suffixes appear in: future forms, negated present and future (and past, as well as 1sg, in the northern dialect) forms, present and future participles, converbs. // according to my research, about 14% of verbs agree
according to [kibrikkodzasov1988], 40% of verb stems agree
suffix that comes after the root or after a causative suffix is present only in preterite forms and can only have a value of HPL
translation: and some bowls were found shattered

comment: also separate non-obligatory animacy agreement affixes. // "A minority of verb stems in Botlikh carry a slot for noun class agreement"
translation_as_in_source: oh, may the wind take you away
translation: oh, may the wind take you away

comment: prefixes between two stems are found in compounds. // "... большое количество глаголов имеет в своем составе классные показатели". according to [kibrikkodzasov1988], 30% of verbs agree; according to my research, about 13% of verbs agree

prefixes between two stems are found in compounds. sometimes the vowel that follows the prefix may change as well. // "Большинство глаголов годоберинского языка не имеет в своем составе классных показателей". according to my research, about 24% of verbs agree
according to my research, about 15% of verbs agree

the human plural agreement suffix is found only in the aorist and perfect forms'; in imperatives, 'to express a more polite demand, the gender markers –w / –j can be added to the intransitive suffix'. // according to [kibrikkodzasov1988], 40% of verbs agree; according to my research, about 18% of verbs agree
there are no noun classes in Armenian; animacy distinction is only present in nominal declension
according to [kibrikkodzasov1988], most verbs don't agree; according to my research, about 12% of verbs agree

prefixes between two stems are found in compounds. some preverbs seem to contain agreement slots, e.g.: "гьаб= образует глаголы со значением удаления спереди ориентира (гьаб+бахъес "убежать" < бухъес "двигаться", гьаб+буцес "вести на поводу" < буцес "держать")", cf. paradigm from Yusupov 2014: "[гьавуц-ес, гьарруц-ес; гьардуц-ес]"
some verbs may have two agreement slots at once - one at the end of the preverb and another before the verb stem
judging by an example from Evstigneeva 2017. Agreement in Chirag Dargwa, agreeing preverbs are present: sa-b-b-arχː-ib PRV-HPL-HPL-встретить:PF-AOR

Most initial stems are preceded by a class agreement marker. However, all consonant-initial and some vowel-initial stems have no class agreement markers. The past marker ca=b agrees as well, but it seems to be a clitic as although it is usually added at the end of the verb form, it can attach to other words in the sentence depending on the focus
the prefix agrees with the absolutive argument. the suffix, if the subject is in 3rd person, can agree with either the subject or the object, which will affect the voice of the verb

unlike in standard Dargwa, there are no verbs with class agreement suffixes. "Классные показатели обнаруживаются в структуре глагольных основ, наречий, послелогов, превербов, ...", "классный иреверб биж- (виж-, риж-) «внутри, но направлению внутрь» ..."

Verbs may only have gender markers in the prefix position, and not all verbs have this slot (though most do). "the preverbal element may have its own gender agreement position". an agreement suffix is found in the copula
an agreeing infix is found in the auxiliary. // "Классный префикс присутствует в большинстве минимальных основ"
example: q˳aj-te χː˳ala-te dali ka-d=irxː-u-le — dimʡaˁn-te gu=d-d=urkː-u-le
translation_as_in_source: крупные (деньги) я кладу (под подушку) — мелкие нахожу
translation: big ones (money) I put (under the pillow) — small ones I find

comment: there are no noun classes in Georgian
there are no noun classes in Tat
some verbs have suffixes or infixes // "Классных переходных глаголов значительно меньше, чем неклассных переходных глаголов"
form: b- / p- / j- / r- / c- / č- / s- / z- / ∅-; bi- / vi- / va- / dæ- / du- / ji- / ja-

comment: there are no noun classes in Kumyk
there are no noun classes in Nogai
infixes appear in some past tense forms regardless of whether the verb has a prefix or not

form: d- / r- / j- / b- / tˡ / t; -r-

comment: prefix in duratives, imperatives and masdars, terminatives, finals and potentials. may be absent due to different (semantic, phonological) rules
translation: to beat (something belonging to the 3rd class)

comment: the prefix may be preceded by a preverb or a negative or prohibitive infix, in which case it is considered to be an infix itself. the rare cases where a verb does not have class agreement "...stem from the limitations imposed because certain lexemes can only be combined with one particular class or because class forms are neutralized as a result of phonetic processes" [Alekseev 1994: 276]

La majorité des bases verbales sont accordables, c'est-à-dire qu'elles comportent une place pour cette indexation avant la consonne radicale, soit à l'initiale (quelques racines) soit, le plus souvent, entre un préverbe et la racine: la flexion est donc interne. // Trois racines de forme -a-C-(a) ont manifestement été ‘dépréverbées’ puisque qu’on trouve leur consonne radicale aussi préverbée, et pour deux avec un autre élargissement (-r). Noter que aqayc reçoit deux préfixes d’accord: babqayc ‘les avoir gardés’.
there are no noun classes in Lezgian
verbs that lack agreement are not mentioned in the source; however, in [magometov1970:57]: "В рутульском глаголе префикс, классный показатель не сохранился"
a suffix appears alongside the prefix in a special present tense form
a suffix appears alongside the prefix in special present and future tense forms

translation: i will write a letter to my father
what did you hit me with?

comment: most verbs have slots between the preverb and the root, but some have one before the preverb. two slots appear in compounds and causatives, which consist of a potentialis stem and a conjugating form of the verb 'do'
there are no noun classes in Udi
About 30% of the verb roots agree in gender...

the conditional, future tense and nonwitnessed tense endings have class agreement. also in some verb forms (causative, perfect, optative) a form of the auxiliary 'be', which has class agreement, is used and is similar to an affix. // "63 90/294 verbs (30.6%). The 294 are all of the non-pluractional, non-plural simple verb roots. If pluractionals and plurals are included the count is 109/393 = 27.7%"

agreement suffixes are found in causatives, though formally they're considered by Desheriev to be forms of the verb 'do' compounded with the stem of the main verb. // "Однако большинство глаголов относится к классным". // according to [Harris 2009], there is an agreeing preverb d-ux in Tsova-Tush. However, Harris regards preverbs in Tsova-Tush as not being part of the verb form. She also analyzes the agreement suffixes as suffixes derived from forms of the verb do, while Holisky and Gagua even consider them comparable to inflection. They also refer to the preverb system as developing and separate the preverbs from the verb forms with spaces. // According to [Harris 2009], 74.47% of verbs have agreement 'somewhere in the stem' (likely including suffixes), while only 21.53% have root agreement prefixes.
there are no noun classes in Azerbaijani
Большинство глаголов классных показателей не имеют
prefixes are present only in verbs with vowel-initial roots, but not in all of them // "About one third of the simple verb stems, which make up around 270 items, have agreement prefixes"
the infix is referred to in the grammar as "apophony in the root" // "About 44% of the roots can have a class prefix"
There are two classes of verbs, those that start with a vowel and therefore have an initial slot for a gender/number agreement marker (about 23%)...
Но большинство глаголов все же по классам не изменяется
